Posts.Content: And oh yes my friend had cancer and she was absolutely fine subtext : it's nothing just shut up and get over yourself ALSO be strong, be brave, be positive  me to my self " you try it a*sehole !
Posts.Title: Angry !

Posts.Content: my sister said "its really upset me ( your cancer ) so I've booked myself a mammogram !
Posts.Title: Angry !

Posts.Content: Is it just me or has anyone elses sense if smell gone haywire ? Places like home bargains with their cheap chemicals make me feel horribly sick and I used to love the smell of fresh coffee but now it smells totally different and very odd although I still like the taste ! I'm weird aren't I ? Bet it's just me !
Posts.Title: Weird sense of smell ?

Posts.Content: Interesting and kind of reassuring but I didn't have Chemo - Mx and radiotherapy but my smell & taste went weird 5 months earlier - have wondered if that's when the cancer became invasive. One things for sure it's a real snd so fat permanent change in bidy chemistry. Impossible to explain if you have't experienced it.  Thanks fellow weird smellers !
Posts.Title: Weird sense of smell ?

Posts.Content: Wow that's incredible but I do believe that animals have that 6th sense and also interesting your sense of smell changed before your diagnosis like mine ! X
Posts.Title: Weird sense of smell ?

Posts.Content: Amazing stories ! Looks like this is definitely a "thing !"  I wonder if these studies will ever be published ?  Whiffy Williams !
Posts.Title: Weird sense of smell ?

Posts.Content: Hi All sitting here at Christie's Hospital in Manchester waiting for my 7th /15 Radium treatment. Just wondering is anyone ever houng to tell me how long I can expect / hope to survive after all my treatment. No one can be certain I get that. I'm 61 and I want to start planning my life again...  Is this a silly question ? If not who do I ask, even to just get a rough idea ? Hope no one offended by this Dulcie
Posts.Title: Survival rates, life expectancy ? Do they give you an idea / guess...

Posts.Content: A friend of mine sent it to me along with a " you see its not so bad" email.  I am no drama Queen but minimising someone elses cancer is disrespectful and shows no empathy whatsoever
Posts.Title: Anybody else been Victoria Derbyshired????????

Posts.Content: Welcome from me too. I'm quite new and just 3 days post mastectomy and have 10 days to wait for my stage and grade and next treatment plan. I'm still in shock but the support and advice on this forum is so helpful as no one else understands like us fellow travellers. Much love X
Posts.Title: New to the site after being diagnosed with breast cancer a week a...

Posts.Content: Thanks Theresa, Lynn and Helen... Stopped the Anastrazole just couldn't cope with the pain and feelibg 100 tears old. Rang my BC Nurse who said I may be cvery sensitive to AI's like you Theresa. She suggested I take a break until I get back from my Singing holiday in Vegas and then maybe try Letrozole again, if thats no good then perhaps Tamoxifen.  There is no way I could manage to get aroubd the huge Hotels and walk and keep up with my Chorus the way I was on Anastrazole and maybe even Letrozole. Don't want to give up the hormone blickers as they offer a goid protection... feeling very old and worn down with all this. It's just not me, im normally so positive snd energetic... oh well I'm alive, but its not easy living xx
Posts.Title: Can I change back from Anastrazole to Letrozole ?

Posts.Content: I Changed to Anastrazole 10 days ago due to SE with Letrozole but I'm 3 times worse with the Anastrazole.  Can I just put myself back on Letrozole and tell the GP what I have done ? I'm going to Las Vegas next Sunday with my Chorus to compete in an International Ladies Barbershop Contest and I simply couldnt walk about with these tablets.  Anyone else done this ? Dulcie
Posts.Title: Can I change back from Anastrazole to Letrozole ?

Posts.Content: What questions should I ask please ? I dont know what I need to know? Thanks In Advance
Posts.Title: Hormone & Radiotherapy Consultation Tomorrow - what should I ask ...

Posts.Content: We are changed forever whatever our cancer diagnosis. The muggles dont get it unless they are unusually empathetic and most people often inuding lovingvfamily lose patience and interpret lack of moaning as "normal service must be resumed asap so my life doesnt have to change too much."  Partly its total lack of insight and partly us protecting our loved ones from our eebie jeebies and tbh I never expected the emotional impact to be as great ir greater than the humungous physical issues. Lets me honest tho, it is absolute sh*t and the fear is always there somewhere. I know im acting positive to save others and myselfvthe pain of my reality. I'm pretty sure the brittle, fake, smiley, permanently positive types are either genuinely rare as rocking horse poo or emotionally insensitive or just not very bright.  I'm no negative nora, i am truly grateful for my ( big ) surgery, my life and even my s*dding letrozole thst means I walk like annarthritic cowboy, I trily value whatever future I can enjoy.... but it was, is and will always be realky really shocking, unfair & sh*t that my and your lives are forever changed - much more than others we can not take a healthy future for granted.  Thank God for this place where we can cone and speak "our truth."  The fake smilers are nit doibg their mental health any favours at all. ❤️ Dulcie ❤️
Posts.Title: Why ?

Posts.Content: So sorry, my post was not a critical of any individuals here.  My BC Nurse and Cancer counsellor both said what I meant when they said the people who smile through all the consultations and say they are fine all the time are the ones who they really worry about. We all have to face the enormity of this at some point and in our own way. Its wonderful to smile in recovery. I'm so glad you want to smile, I'm a smiler myselfvery often. I'm also someone who has been devastated my the ongoing shock of my cancer diagnosis but most people in my life dont know because I'm a doer, I don't like moaning, and I'm blooming hilarious ! However I need to be real sonewhere.  The finger wagging "be positive" "be strong" "be grateful" brigade, help many but can also upset a lot more who are still struggling and are more sensitive and may take longer to deal with their Cancer. I am honestly still in shock. One year on. My consultant said PTSD is quite usual for many of us for years, but you can be happy in parrallel too.  Blessings to all of you  Dulcie
Posts.Title: Why ?

Posts.Content: Feel like I have regressed this week since my seroma was drained on tuesday It actually feels worse not better. GP gave me antibiotic as wound looks red. BC nurse said second week is often a bit worse as things settle down.  Has anyone else found this ? Fed up and missing big party tonight. Sorry to bang on and moan. Dulcie the miserable
Posts.Title: 18 days post surgery and very sore / tender

Posts.Content: Thanks all for sharing your own opinions experiences and choices. I have also researched and tried the dairy free, vegan, option and don't for a minute think that one size fits all. I'm sure none of us want to lecture others either. in addition to my mastectomy and doing cancer I am also recovering from a total knee replacement and am obviously trying to get active and significantly increase my mobility. If dealing with Obesity and Cancer, diet and hormone related issues was easy it would have been sorted out years ago as it costs the NHS and economy billions. both issues are linked, complex and individual. For instance all my friends got fat on HRT but I lost weight on oestrogen only patches.... which of course probably contributed to my highly hormonally reactive breast cancer... now on letrozole my body won't give up the fat easily.... I will look for a nutritionist an integrative ( functional medic ?) but can I just ask the GP for blood tests to assess vitamin & mineral levels? What do I say or ask for please ?
Posts.Title: Vitamin supplements & diet advice ?

Posts.Content: Hi All Before my op I was advised to stop all vits & supplements so I did. I want to resume vitamin supplements where should I go for best advice ? Even the most famous hospitals wont offer advice. What do others take. I have read so much about best cancer beating diet and had so much conflicting advice that I don't know what or who to trust now. I went vegan from day of diagnosis to a month ago. Various diets all claim scientific proof, alkaline diet, vegan, ketogenic, dairy free, low fat, hflc etc  Am being much more active now and ready to tackle the comfort eating weight but just not sure who to believe. Low fat high carb makes me crave, tired and no weightloss. I prefer low carb but that trnds to be high meat and I still avoid dairy due to hormones in it..., Confused.com
Posts.Title: Vitamin supplements & diet advice ?

Posts.Content: Fiona72 Ihave been diagnosed with lobular breast cancer. I'm to get a mastectomy on my left breast and removal of the lymph nodes. My doctor has told me he will not consider a double mastectomy, even though the risks are high in developing cancer on the right side. He had also told me that I will not be co sidered for reconstructive surgery because of  my BMI is too high. I'm feeling pretty bad about myself at the moment. And wonder if this is just standard practice. Has anyone been faced with the same situation ? Can I challenge his decision?   Oh Blimey, poor you. As if you don't feel bad enough already. I am pretty overweight and had reconstruction. I would definitely speak to your breast care nurse. In fact if you don't feel happy with the surgeons approach you can ask to be treated by another. Despite being in total shock, as no doubt you are too, I asked to be treated at another hospital I knew well ( and has much better Cancer facilities ) I decided if I had to deal with this horrible disease I was going to be assertive for once in my life ! You will get through this and you should be treated with dignity and respect. Sending love and positive vibes. Dulcie
Posts.Title: I'm not allowed reconstructive surgery because my BMI is to high

Posts.Content: Oh golly sorry you have this dilemma but I am your mirror image ! I had a total knee replacement last October and should find out on Tuesday if I need chemo. God forbid it losens my knee I am only just walking better after 14 months !  Hope we both get answers to this ??!!! Eeeek
Posts.Title: Chemo effect on knee replacement

Posts.Content: Hello Calm 15 why the name ? anyhow Good Luck with your surgery tomorrow whatever you have decided. I will be sending you love and healing vibes.  I have now decided after much agonising and doing my list of pros and cons to have the bilateral Mx and immediate implant recon with slings. Seeing surgeon on Tuesday and need to see the shrink to make sure I'm not mad ( mmmm may not pass that one ) Take Care and come back for support if you need it X
Posts.Title: Mastectomy - Single or Double?

Posts.Content: Hi just as a balance I had a total mastectomy and immediate silicone implant reconstruction. I was not expected to need Radio Therapy but my tumour was very large so they decided RT was necc. Anyhow my breast ( implant ) has shrunk, become mis shapen and hard. Its not pretty but I'm glad to be alive.  The scars whilst huge are almost invisible now ( 9 months later ) but I may get myself beautified if I can face it. Re creams I only used Aloe Vera or coconut oil and was never sore and did not burn. I was told to use Factor 50 if I ever go in the sun. You don't need to spend a fortune to protect your skin and no cream would have prevented my implant from contracture. There is no pain with RT but keeping still is a bit stressful at first but you soon become an expert. Hope this helps x
Posts.Title: Minimising radiotherapy side effects

Posts.Content: Hi there, I too am facing a similar decision, and am agonising over it in case I make the wrong choice. I guess we just can't predict the unknown. I do wonder if I'm obsessing over this " do I remove a healthy breast to protect myself from future cancer and achieve symmetry?" Dilemma rather than focus on the life threatening disease we are also dealing with. Good luck with your decision, when do you have your surgery ? i am booked in for 23 November, but if I go for the bilateral it will be delayed as I have to see a psychologist to make sure the decision is ok for me. Idiotically I am fixated on the date and don't want to have it delayed. However 2 breast reconstructions take double the time of one and theatre time is tight, so I must not let imaptience cloud my decision. I never imagined having to make this choice did you!? wishing you all the best.. Dulcie
Posts.Title: Mastectomy - Single or Double?

Posts.Content: Whatever you decide will be perfect for you. once you decide im sure you will feel much more peaceful, well I certain,y do. It was so hard thrashing the variables around all the time, but I feel much calmer now and sure you will too.  No no one can walk in our shoes and no one can judge us.  Big hugs
Posts.Title: Mastectomy - Single or Double?

Posts.Content: hi All, still in shock after 2 very painful mammograms 11 biopsies, after first 5 biopsies got results this Friday and surgeon said it was high grade DCIS and I have to wait 10 days for the results of the other 6 to see what area of surgery I need, lumpectomy or mastectomy. They were all pretty matter of fact and I don't want to be treated at that hospital. Does anyone know how or what you do to go to another hospital / surgeon ?   i'm In Shock, sad, frightened and tearful, I guess like everyone else. I just don't want to talk to my family and friends, I don't know what to say, I'm always the jolly supportive one and I just can't be that. My Mum, 2 maternal aunts ( her sisters ) and my cousin all died of BC so I'm Really scared.     Thanks All, wishing you all the best possible recovery X
Posts.Title: DCIS - hospital /surgeon choice / advice please ?

Posts.Content: Thank you all for your advice whilst I try to get my head round this. I didn't want big dramas just a bit of kindness. I am based South Manchester and would prefer to go to the hospital where I attended the family history clinic for 20 years where they are very kind, skilled and calm. I couldn't afford the BRCA tests when I was offered them. Why would this affect treatment please? When I read all your posts I really see I don't understand half the terminology.    Barbara amazing you haven't told your Mum but I get it, it's hard enough handling your own reactions. I am trying to be adult and not upset my 29 yr old daughter too much. I was 17 when my mum had her rad mastectomy and no one took care of my feelings, understandably my Mum was in pieces, but not too evolved re parenting, others stress as well as her own.    Im rambling now, just want to thank you all for sharing your stories and support. Still scared witless but I'm a tough cookie and will find positivity somehow, maybe as you all say when I gave a treatment plan. Dulcie
Posts.Title: DCIS - hospital /surgeon choice / advice please ?

Posts.Content: Quick Update : sent in Resignation today ( eeeeeeek ! ) After working for 40 years I will finish at the end of March ! Exciting and a bit scary but less so thanks to all your brilluant support and encouragement.  I have survived Cancer and now it's time to really "Live !"
Posts.Title: Retiring but scared...

Posts.Content: Hi All hope each of you are ok ? Its a scary road this cancer journey isn't it. I'm just wanting to get this first part done now and get the cancer out, who knows what will happen next.  I'm trying to be positive as much as possible but have bad times too. Reading the book Biology of Belief and finding it fascinating. Also read Beat Cancer & Reclaim your health so eating loads ( not all ) vegan foods and consulting homeopath and tapping ( EFT ) as well as taking surgeon and BC Nurses advice. Keeping me busy anyhow ! I'm a "doer" and beed to at least feel I can "do" something to help myself.  ????????????!!!Soooo any advice please re what to take with me to hospital ? Guessing Pyjamas best ( had total knee replacement last year and nightie best for acess to that ! ) ?????????????? Any other bits of advice ?I'm calm  on the outside tummy started the occasional lurch when I think of what is ahead. Good Luck to all my wonderful supportive fellow travellers. We will get there by supporting each other and sharing love and healing vibes.   Dulcie x
Posts.Title: Preparation For Mastectomy & Recon on Monday - Advice please ?

Posts.Content: i have decided to retire from work at the end of March. I am ( a youngish ) 62 and have worked all my adult life. I earn a high salary and don't have any pension provision for when I finish so for 4 years until I get my state pension things will be tight on my husbands wages. I am retiring because The Letrozole SE are exhausting and I find I am just constantly tired. I also want to get fit, lose some weight and invest in my health after years of stress. However.... I'm scared. Scared of being skint, scared of becoming a sofa sloth ( not gonna happen ) just scared of this huge change. Instinctively it feels right tho. None of us know how long we will live but I do not want to work until I drop. Am I being crazy ? Has anyone else done this ?  D
Posts.Title: Retiring but scared...

Posts.Content: Wow thank you for all of your input. I thought no one else would have thought like me ! It feels scary because at 62 I cant go back if it goes wrong but from most responses I will make it work. I will definitely ring up re benefits thank you for the advice.  I have always been pretty good at being frugal and we have no debts. My husband has said he will support me too but he is more optimistic than me financially altho he works for himself and wages can vary, I was always the big earner but now he says it's his turn. Thanks so much I feel so much better after all your input. Maybe I'll even start writing that book !
Posts.Title: Retiring but scared...

Posts.Content: Just to add my support and positive vives to all the others. We all assume the worst but it may not be, some ofvthe BC nurses can be a bit clumsy in the phone. Whatever the outconebyou have suppirt here with no need to protect us, we save that for our kids xx
Posts.Title: I need help please.

Posts.Content: Hello I would love some advice I am panicking about weight gain. I was trying to lose weight at SW when diagnosed but have struggled all my life.  I now try to be 90% vegan / organic since diagnosis but have put about 10lbs on with increased carbs !!  I was thinking about rejoining Slimming World again but I'm just about to start Letrozole this week and Radiotherapy in the next 2-3 weeks. What would your advice be please ?
Posts.Title: New 'Ask a dietitian' feature available

Posts.Content: Seeing my surgeon to talk about booking in for LD Flap on Monday but just read another post on here from someone saying they cant swim properly and in constant pain. Might leave mine alone...   Interested to hear what your friends ( of friends ) say. Xx
Posts.Title: Having second thoughts about type of reconstruction

Posts.Content: Thank you all very much for all your advice, I need the money, my sick pay has run out and I feel under pressure. Much of the pressure is self imposed because work need me.  My work is not physical apart from driving 1.5 hours a day but its demanding and stressful. I actually have 2 jobs. I will try and work from home as much as poss. Yes I need counselling the emotional side is massive but Im duch an actress everyone thinks I'm amazing ! lol
Posts.Title: How many people worked through RT? Is it doable ?

Posts.Content: Just wanted an idea of how tired I might be...  Silly question I know we are all different, for instance I was diagnosed in Mid Oct, Mx end Nov and I'm still in shock. Of course its doable as everyone says, but I'm still stunned. Dulcie
Posts.Title: How many people worked through RT? Is it doable ?

Posts.Content: Hi Jenny Its very hard but try not to second guess everything. Can you ring your BC Nurse to chat it over ? I had a left mastectomy dure to large (9cm) ductile tumour plus extensive dcis and a couple of little tiddlers. I'm not blasé its just 6 months since my op and you do evetually calm down although I am still in diagnosis shock if that makes sense. So .... I had Mx Sentinal node biopsy, and immediate recon as i was not expected to need Radiotherapy. On discovering the hugeness of my tumour I was then advised to have RT to prevent recurrence in chest wall and skin ( yuk !)  My implant has suffered, shrunk, gone lumpy and is tight and mishapen ( lovely !.) I may leave it alone or I might have it replaced or removed I haven't decided yet. The skin needs to recover from the RT sunburn in anycase. My observations are as follows 1) mastectomy with recon - nowhere near as painful as I imagined ( nothing like the pain of my knee replacement ) 2) size match of silicone implant was much smaller than natural breast and even smaller after RT 3) they did not know I would need RT or would not have agreed to immediate implant 4) i had big tumour but no node involvement 5) i did not like the drains but they are fine, sore but not painful 6) i had seroma - fill up of fluid and had it drained once which was idd but fine 7) i did not need chemo as onco dx test had score of  zero then 10 8) for me the emotional shock of diagnosis  ( where you are now ) was and is the worst bit of this whole cancer scare 9) for me - and this is just for me as its so idividual, even tho my implant in odd and bumpy now I am glad I had it as I still have a slight cleavage and I am a person who cares  10) I really thought a mishapen implant would be horrific - it isn't - its healing well - just bumpy 11) however awful this all is its better than the alternative Hope this helps you... Good Luck and keep asking questions - in time you can help others Dulcie
Posts.Title: waiting for mastectomy and sentinel node biopsy - what about reconstruction...

Posts.Content: Hi there, one of my idc tumours turned out to be 9 cm !!!! my dcis was 12 cm and another idc tumour teeny tiny 9ml  they are notoriously difficult to spot, this is why cancer is a killer and has proven so hard to predict, diagnose, treat and cure. the fact that cancer are normal cells one day and  look completely nirmal before they start to "look" or "behave" differently explains how hard it is to identify. no one could have predicted my whole area of DCIS woukd turn out to be tumour, which pretty much covered my breast from east to west was all one tumour.  when its in the duct it looks just like calcification along the ducts which presents just like dcis to manograms and ultrasound scans - the 16 biopsies I had cant cover an area that huge - they are spot checks and surgery is the only real way to fibd the extent of disease.  Essentially cancer cells are like people - the cells can look Angelic whilst being up to no good !! I totally understand your anger - mine presents as shock ! Im still in shock Total Mx 23-11-15 finished RT last week. I seem to constantky chant WTF in my head. I have no mental filing system for this... I had never really imagined how a cancer diagnosis would affect me emotionally. I get myself positive and think about great things and how to recast my life ( we can always make pisitive choices ) then I get a letter for people with "life limiting illnesses " and I'm all over the place, my head can't file that one. I'm determined to make the next chapter matter, to have fun and not just sleepwalk through the life I have left. I am desperate to know how long I have so I can plan and prioritise, I so dont want to work myself to death always waiting gor the good stuff to happen, but no b*gger can tell me.  I have decided to "just go for it !' and live like I will live forever and still to fit in as many great things as I can. I wish you all the very best, enjoy your walk and stamp out that anger and then maybe plan some wonderful things, there is no one to blame.  Hope im not preaching  Dulcie
Posts.Title: how can you not detect a 30 mm tumour!

Posts.Content: Emotional today looking back on the last year. Positives I am very glad to be alive I'm grateful my huge area of DCIS breast disease (12cm ) was very slow growing and only 2 areas had become invasive so Grade 2 Stage 2b I have hours and hours when I don't even think about Cancer  I have a lovely supportive family I have a good job 2 days per week ( 100 miles away so v tiring ) I cherish evvery day with my loved ones I had clear margins and they said they had got all the cancer I sm grateful I has 61 years of reasonably good health Negs I'm still emotionally bruised and I worry a lot that it will come back I feel guilty for not being Positive Polly all the time Most people think I'm fine because thats how it looks I worry they can't tell if it has come back as I have no breast to mammogram and hosp did no other tests  I have a very badly defiormed reconstruction I have to get removed and maybe replaced I feel sad, tired and have lots of unpleasant side effects from my AI's I am forecer changed I wannt my positivity back. I suspect I'm not alone.
Posts.Title: 12 months ago today since my mastectomy...

Posts.Content: Hiya, sure you are not beubg self indulgent and I'm sure your hubby doesn't understand how shocking this whole cancer journey can be for some of us and how long the emotional effects can last.  I am certain it is PTSD. I had counselling et a Cancer centre, thibk I will apply for more. I was always so active and extremely positive 99% if the time so this is a shock.  Can I ask was your hubby understanding before you had Cancer ?  Dulcie xx
Posts.Title: 12 months ago today since my mastectomy...

Posts.Content: Totally understsnd how you feel :-(  I had mastectomy on 23 /11/15 git results but I am still waiting for onco type dx results 6.5 weeks later. I'm going demented just want to get on with my treatment but wint know if I'm gaving chemo until results back from US so no treatment at all yet.  I want to get going with it all but I am also dreading it.  Hugs x
Posts.Title: Waiting for results a nightmare

Posts.Content: So after waiting 7 weeks since my Mx op and 5 weeks since pathology report I have just been told that US lab are retesting my Onco dx but were waiting for go ahead from hospital. BC phoned California today to give them the go ahead and now I'm waiting snd wondering what treatment will be and when it will start. I may hear today ( yeh right )  or tomorrow.... Exhausted with all the waiting snd worry but now wonder why would they retest ? Has anyone else heard of this ?
Posts.Title: Why are they Re testing my Onco type dx with another sample ?

Posts.Content: My own sister told me she would rather have breast cancer than have lost her husband !
Posts.Title: Your cancer wasn't bad then....

Posts.Content: Yes its a private room just you and the photographer in my case a woman. They take pics from various angles ( naked from waist up ) in my case to help choose implant for immediate reconstruction.  Mine looks nothing like my lovely pr madtecomy breast ! However the medical photography is fast fine and dignified, try not to worry. Dulcie
Posts.Title: Medical Illustration/Clinical Photography

Posts.Content: Lol they make the bots wait outside. X
Posts.Title: Medical Illustration/Clinical Photography

Posts.Content: Whoops boys not bots !
Posts.Title: Medical Illustration/Clinical Photography

Posts.Content: Is there official advice ?  What are the facts, experiences please?
Posts.Title: Alcohol ??? yes, no, some ?

Posts.Content: I see my BC nurse next Wednesday, having been diagnosed last Wednesday with grade 2 invasive ductile BC. She will help me look at the pros and cons of the variables the surgeon left me to decide. The only definite is I need one total mastectomy on my left breast where there is a large area of DCIS, calcisfication and a small different area of invasive cancer which has been identified from biopsies. There could be more of course. Due to my very strong family history ( mother 2 maternal aunts and maternal cousin all having BC ) surgeon said it might be wise to have a bilateral mastectomy to prevant any future cancer in the other breast. I also have to decide if I want immediate or delayed reconstruction (s)  ( implants ) as I couldn't face the other type as such huge operations, or indeed no reconstruction at all. My my mind is just ceased up.  What at do reconstructed breasts look like ? My leaflet said they don't look like normal breasts.  How did other people decide ? I know it's personal but I would appreciate some of your advice and any things you wish you had known and would or wouldn't have done again? I'm 61 and still care what I look like but I'm not in my 30's as some of you lovely young women are... I am however still totally shocked and still trying to process all this.... btw you are all right, it is the waiting that's the hardest bit. This bit isn't great, but at least I k ow what's happening next and as much as they know for now. Bloody Nora, I had great tits as well !
Posts.Title: How do I choose, one mastectomy or two, immediate or delayed reconstruction...

Posts.Content: I wasn't sure about asking about specific surgeons but thats a good idea, thank you. Can I just thank you all for all your help and advice. Im sorry i havent replied to you all but im afraid Im really immobilised by this. I will try to be more positive asap. I feel very lucky to have found this thread. Dulcie X

Posts.Content: Thank you so much for replying Barsian it's just an implant, or 2. Couldn't face using other of my body.  What was the pain like post op and how long does it last ?  thanks for helping me Dulcie

You'll soon be out pogo ing ( eek )  Really kind of you to diary all these points that's just the sort of stuff I have been wondering about. no one came back to me about the surgeon but I'm going with my instinct as I like him.  Surgery Date re may change now I have opted for bilateral as it takes twice as long . sending healing huGs

Posts.Title: When is catching Cancer early ?

Posts.Content: People keep saying to me " at least they caught it early."  What is consideted early please ?
Posts.Title: When is catching Cancer early ?

Posts.Content: GET IN Dad Indeed ! So pleased for you both. In a tough situatiokn that it great news. I was quietly going round the twist here so my 9cm tiddler can be considered "history" I hope. Thanks For the Encouragement :-)
Posts.Title: When is catching Cancer early ?

Posts.Content: I was just clutching at straws as I'm frightened. ;-)
Posts.Title: When is catching Cancer early ?

Posts.Content: Crystaljuju I would agree. Surely it's anything up to having metastasized to different organs and becomes incurable. If it's curable (whether that's permanantly or temporary who knows) then it must have been caught early enough To respond to Treatment.  BC tumours larger than 20mm are still curable.  We live in hope x  Well I hope so my IDC grade 1 measured 90 mm !  my grade 2 measured 6 mm my DCIS measured 120 mm Scarily big but hope I'm ok as no lymph node involvement and clear margins...
Posts.Title: When is catching Cancer early ?

Posts.Content: GET IN Dad Indeed ! So pleased for you both. In a tough situatiokn that it great news. I was quietly going round the twist here so my 9cm tiddler can be considered "history" I hope. Thanks For the Encouragement :-)
Posts.Title: When is catching Cancer early ?

Posts.Content: People keep saying to me " at least they caught it early."  What is consideted early please ?
Posts.Title: When is catching Cancer early ?

Posts.Content: Crystaljuju I would agree. Surely it's anything up to having metastasized to different organs and becomes incurable. If it's curable (whether that's permanantly or temporary who knows) then it must have been caught early enough To respond to Treatment.  BC tumours larger than 20mm are still curable.  We live in hope x  Well I hope so my IDC grade 1 measured 90 mm !  my grade 2 measured 6 mm my DCIS measured 120 mm Scarily big but hope I'm ok as no lymph node involvement and clear margins...
Posts.Title: When is catching Cancer early ?

Posts.Content: Good Luck for tomorrow JJ, All will be well ! I was terrified ( single madtectomy and immediate recon ) but it was exactly as the others have said, well organised, caring, smooth and very do able.  Drains a bit irritating but NOTHING compared to child birth so if you are a Mum have no fear ! Big Love x
Posts.Title: Bilateral mastectomy and recon on Thursday sacred!!!!
